title: Thermal energy transfer - metal cube in water

content.prompt: A metal cube is heated until its temperature is 200∘C. The metal cube is then submerged in water that has a temperature of 35∘C. The system, which includes the metal cube and water, is isolated from its surroundings and is allowed to reach thermal equilibrium. A student claims that the temperature of the water will eventually increase to 200∘C. Is the student’s claim correct? Why or why not?

choices.label: No, because the metal cube will transfer energy to the water until the metal cube reaches a temperature of 35∘C.
No, because the metal cube cools down and the water and the metal cube have the same temperature in equilibrium.
Yes, because the cube will transfer all of its energy to the water.
Yes, because the equilibrium temperature is equal to the greater temperature of the two interacting materials.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
